text.p: Nigeria's military authorities have executed two convicted armed robbers by a firing squad, the national news agency reported on Monday.
It said several people from nearby Yola and Jimeta towns trekked a distance of about 10 km (six miles) to watch the execution which took place at the weekend in the northern Veninkilan village.
The executed men were convicted of armed robbery and inflicting injuries on their victims during separate incidents in 1992, the agency said.

The local and international communities have criticised the Nigerian government for executing robbers. But the military authorities, under fire for alleged human rights abuses, say it is the only way to stem violent crime which is common in most of the nation's impoverished cities.
